start_main_title: Provide identity verification details for a PSC or relevant legal entity
start_service_description: Use this service to provide verification details for a company's person with significant control (PSC), or a relevant legal entity's (RLE) relevant officer.
start_service_user_list_item1: individual PSCs providing their own verification details
start_service_user_list_item2: RLEs providing details of a relevant officer – this includes if they are replacing a previous relevant officer
start_service_user_list_item3: people providing verification details on behalf of a PSC or RLE
start_service_new_pscs: New PSCs and RLEs should check they are on the
start_service_restriction_description: You cannot use this service if the PSC has their personal information protected at Companies House (or is waiting for the results of an application).
start_find_details_main_link: Find out more about PSCs, RLEs and relevant officers
start_find_details_psc_list: A PSC is someone who owns or controls a company. They’re sometimes called ‘beneficial owners’. A PSC has at least one of the following:
start_find_details_psc_list_item1: more than 25% of shares in the company
start_find_details_psc_list_item2: more than 25% of voting rights in the company
start_find_details_psc_list_item3: the right to appoint or remove the majority of the board of directors
start_find_details_rle_heading: Relevant legal entities (RLEs) and relevant officers
start_find_details_rle_description: If the PSC is a corporate body or firm, we refer to it as a relevant legal entity (RLE).
start_find_details_rle_list: RLEs are required to provide information about a relevant officer. The relevant officer needs to be:
start_find_details_rle_list_item1: a director of the entity, or someone whose roles and responsibilities correspond to that of a company director
start_when_to_verify_description: There are specific dates from which you are required to provide verification details. This depends on whether you were added to the Companies House register before or after identity verification requirements were introduced, on
start_when_to_verify_not_early: You will not be able to provide verification details earlier than required.
start_when_individual_before_date_1: If you were added to the Companies House register before
start_when_individual_before_date_2: , you must provide your verification details within 14 days of company's confirmation statement date.
start_when_individual_after_date_2: , you must provide your verification details within 14 days of the date Companies House accepted your PSC notification filing.
start_when_rle_before_date_1: If the RLE was added to the Companies House register before
start_when_rle_before_date_2: , you must provide its relevant officer's details within 28 days of company's confirmation statement date.
start_when_rle_after_date_1: If the RLE was added after
start_when_rle_after_date_2: , you must provide its relevant officer's details within 28 days of the date Companies House accepted the RLE notification filing.
start_when_inset: You can find out exactly when you need to provide verification details for a company's PSCs or RLEs by signing into this service and entering the company number.
start_before_verify_description: The PSC or relevant officer must
start_before_list: To use this service, you'll need:
start_before_list_item1: to sign into or create a GOV.UK One Login account
start_before_list_item2: the Companies House personal code for the PSC or relevant officer
start_before_list_item3: the company number for the company they are a PSC or RLE of
start_before_required_description: If you're providing verification details for a relevant officer, you'll need their full name and date of birth.
start_personal_code_details_main_link: What is a Companies House personal code?
start_personal_code_details_description: This is an 11 character code that is given to a person after they have verified their identity with Companies House.
